description._content: Photograph of Robert Anderson, one of a group of photos of the Deseronto branch of the Sons of Scotland. A notice in The Tribune of November 27, 1903, states that the group met on the second Thursday of each month in the Masonic Building (the Clement Block). A Robert Anderson is listed in the 1901 census for Deseronto. He was born in rural Ontario, of Scottish descent, on 13 January 1845. He was a carpenter, earning $400. Living with him were his wife, Eliza A. (born in Ontario on 11 Oct 1853 ) and his children: Aggie M. (born 12 Dec 1875), a book-keeper earning $300; William E. (born 15 April 1897) ; Emma M. (born 21 August 1879), a book-keeper earning $340 and Ada (born 21 Sep 1881), an operator earning $150.
